transcript.text: Dear Colleagues, Finally. Finally, we have succeeded in putting on the agenda this utmost
humanitarian emergency: the situation of the Armenian prisoners of war still detained in
Azerbaijan. Detained in contempt of the Geneva Conventions, in contempt of international law,
in contempt even of the ceasefire agreement. Armenia has freed all its prisoners,
Aliyef is keeping hostages on the pretext that they are terrorists. But the only
terrorists in the affair are those Mr. Erdogan financed to attack Karabakh,
the jihadist mercenaries he brought in from Syria. How many prisoners are still
kidnapped by Azerbaijan? He refuses to say it. Even today in Armenia,
hundreds of families live in the utmost anguish of not knowing whether their sons are dead
or prisoners, victims of numerous cases of torture which have been documented. Armenia
seized the ECHR on the case of nineteen prisoners executed in detention: Misha, Narek, Yurik,
Yelena… We must be their voice. In recent days, we have all received alternating floods of threats
and lies, but we will not be silent. Aliyef speaks of peace and respect...
But how can we believe him when he once again violates the border of Armenia on these days? No reason,
no disagreement, no diplomacy can excuse the violation of the most
fundamental rights. Armenian prisoners of war must be released without delay. Thank you very much.
